title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons hold a 3-4 record as they face Patriots in Week 9 seeking playoff momentum.
Falcons' Bijan Robinson leads NFL in scrimmage yards per game, posing a dual-threat challenge.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed, with a strong secondary headlined by A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts's two-run single gave the Dodgers a 3-0 lead against the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez executed a key defensive play, preventing a Blue Jays comeback, to secure the Dodgers' victory.
The Dodgers' 3-1 win forces a Game 7 against the Toronto Blue Jays in the World Series.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff distributed candy on the T, dressed as characters like Wizard of Oz and a 'T princess.'
Boston police reported Halloween celebrations with SpongeBob sightings and future cadets participating in East Boston events.
Boston Medical Center NICU showcased babies in costumes, including superheroes and Celtics players, made by nurses or donated.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket bought in Marlborough remains unclaimed, expiring November 20, 2025.
The ticket was purchased at New Capital Farms Convenience Store for the November 20, 2024, drawing.
Unclaimed prize money will be redirected to Massachusetts cities and towns if not claimed by the deadline.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married on Halloween at Willows Park in Salem.
The couple chose Halloween for their wedding, expressing it as their favorite holiday.
The ceremony was captured by Jay Willet of WBZ amidst gusty winds, shared by Justice of the Peace Penny Richards.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points in a tight 109-108 victory over the 76ers, achieving their third consecutive win.
Anfernee Simons heavily contributed to the offense, with the Celtics achieving a team-high +23 as they built their lead.
Celtics and 76ers both recorded 56 total rebounds, with Celtics securing more offensive boards, 16-9, during the game.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodied Jackie Kennedy Halloween costume, saying it was a statement about trauma and power.
Jack Schlossberg, JFK's grandson, criticized Fox's costume as 'disgusting, desperate, and dangerous' on social media.
The blood-stained pink suit symbolized Jackie Kennedy's reaction to JFK's assassination; it remains at the National Archives.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Drake London has been targeted 63 times, caught 38 passes, and averages 78.2 yards per game this season.
London will face Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez, noted for not allowing a touchdown in his last 478 coverage snaps.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow states Red Sox are positioned to acquire key players after reaching playoffs in 2025.
Key departures like Alex Bregman's opt-out may create roster gaps for the Red Sox this offseason.
Red Sox have room and strategy to improve, remaining under $25 million luxury tax and strong in prospects.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel introduces changes to Patriots' pregame and traditions, denying intention to separate from team's past.
Patriots introduce offensive starters individually in Week 8, ending a 24-year team introduction tradition.
Patriots lead AFC East at 6-2; changes aim to emphasize winning, with focus on team adjustments and communication.
